paper_abstract: Quantum correlations (QC) are generally considered to be the crucial resource for quantum information processing, however, in practice, the inevitable interaction of the quantum systems with the environment can cause decoherence and thus destroy the QC. In this paper, by comparatively studying the model of a two-qubit system in a common environment with and without dynamical control, we show that dynamical control can be exploited to protect QC from being completely destroyed for a long time. For certain product states, the dynamical control can even be used to generate the QC.
paper_title: DYNAMICAL CONTROL OF QUANTUM CORRELATIONS IN A COMMON ENVIRONMENT
